description: Near-repdigit primes such that all digits are equal except for an end-digit.
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..496 (terms < 10^1000)
mathematica: Select[ Range[ 101, 10^4, 2 ], PrimeQ[ # ] && (Length[ Union[ Take[ RealDigits[ # ][ [ 1 ] ], {1, -2} ] ] ] == 1 || Length[ Union[ Take[ RealDigits[ # ][ [ 1 ] ], {2, -1} ] ] ] == 1) & ]dig[n_] := Sort@Select[Flatten@Table[{d*10^(n - 1) + e*(10^(n - 1) - 1)/9, e + 10 d*(10^(n-1)- 1)/9}, {e, {1,3,7,9}}, {d, Delete[Range@9, e]}], PrimeQ]; Join @@ dig /@ Range[3, 100] (* terms < 10^100, _Giovanni Resta_, Apr 08 2013 *)
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2000
extensions: Four missing terms added by _Giovanni Resta_, Apr 07 2013
